The Congress party has released its second list of candidates for the upcoming Delhi assembly elections, consisting of 26 names. This announcement comes as the party strategizes to strengthen its position in the capital.

title: NFRA penalises Deloitte for alleged lapses in ZEEL audit, debars two partners | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
NFRA penalises Deloitte for alleged lapses in ZEEL audit, debars two partners

Publication Date: December 23, 2023

Source: Mint

The National Financial Reporting Authority (NFRA) has imposed penalties and debarments on Deloitte and two of its partners for professional misconduct during their audits of Zee Entertainment Enterprises Limited (ZEEL) for two financial years.

This ruling involves severe penalties totaling ₹2.15 crore against Deloitte and accusations of missing significant irregularities, including the mishandling of a ₹200-crore fixed deposit by ZEEL.

  • NFRA imposed a ₹2 crore penalty on Deloitte and debarred one partner for five years with a ₹10 lakh fine.
  • The second partner has been debarred for three years with a ₹5 lakh penalty.
  • The actions stem from Deloitte's failure to report irregularities regarding ZEEL’s fixed deposit held with Yes Bank.
  • The ordinance highlights a lack of professional skepticism from the auditors.
“Auditors did not exercise professional skepticism and were grossly negligent in the audit of the matter related to FD closure,” - NFRA

The NFRA's actions reflect the importance of rigorous auditing standards and accountability in financial reporting.
newTitle: NFRA Penalizes Deloitte for Audit Misconduct in ZEEL Case

title: Pushpa 2 box office collection day 20: Allu Arjun questioned over stampede case even as film inches towards ₹1100 cr - Hindustan Times
summary:

  • Arif Mohammed Khan reassigned from Kerala to Bihar, following previous tensions with the state government.

Former Union home secretary Ajay Kumar Bhalla has been appointed as the new Governor of Manipur, replacing Laxman Prasad Acharya, according to an official order from Rashtrapati Bhavan.

title: Congress cries foul over NHRC appointments: Read who are Justices Rohinton, Joseph, Muralidhar and Qureshi, whose names were recommended by Rahul and Kharge - OpIndia
summary:
Congress Criticizes NHRC Appointments Amid Controversy

Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: Various

On December 23, 2024, President Droupadi Murmu appointed retired Justice V Ramasubramanian as the Chairperson of the NHRC, along with two members. The Congress party has raised concerns over the selection process, calling it predetermined.

Key Points:

  • Justice V Ramasubramanian appointed as NHRC Chairperson with Priyank Kanoongo and Bidyut Ranjan Sarangi as members.
  • Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge criticized the selection process as flawed.
  • The dissent letter cites a lack of consultation and claims the process ignored diversity concerns.
  • Gandhi and Kharge recommended Justices Rohinton Nariman and K M Joseph, citing their qualifications and representation of marginalized communities.
  • They argue that the NHRC's credibility relies on representing India's diversity.
“The selection process was fundamentally flawed. This departure undermines the principles of fairness and impartiality.” - excerpt from dissent letter by Gandhi and Kharge

Conclusion

The Congress's proposal of controversial figures brings into question their commitment to judicial impartiality and the strengthening of institutions.
newTitle: Congress Criticizes NHRC Appointments Amid Controversy

title: Tungsten block: Centre tells Tamil Nadu to keep Letter of Intent to Hindustan Zinc on hold - The Hindu
summary:
Centre advises Tamil Nadu to pause Hindustan Zinc's tungsten block bid

Published: December 24, 2024 - Source: The Hindu

The Union Ministry of Mines has requested a re-examination of the Nayakkarpatti tungsten block in Madurai, due to concerns over its biodiversity heritage site status, temporarily halting the issuance of the Letter of Intent to Hindustan Zinc Limited.

  • The Nayakkarpatti tungsten block includes six villages, notably Arittapatti, recognized for its archaeological significance.
  • The Geological Survey of India has been asked to reconsider the boundaries of the block to protect the biodiversity site.
  • The Tamil Nadu government initially notified the existence of the biodiversity site but did not oppose the auction process.
  • Concerns raised from local representations prompted the Ministry to take action.
  • Since being given the power to auction, Tamil Nadu has not auctioned any major mineral blocks in the past nine years.
“When the block was initially put up for auction in February 2024, till the auction result was declared on November 7, 2024, there was no communication from the State government regarding any opposition or concerns about the auction.”

The decision to hold off the auction highlights growing concerns over environmental protection in mining activities in Tamil Nadu.
newTitle: Centre advises Tamil Nadu to pause Hindustan Zinc's tungsten block bid

  • Ajay Kumar Bhalla replaces Anusuiya Uikey in Manipur.
  • VK Singh has been appointed as the Governor of Mizoram.
  • Arif Mohammed Khan and Rajendra Vishwanath Arlekar exchanged governorships between Kerala and Bihar.

“A governor is the constitutional head of a state and has similar powers and functions at the state level as those of the President of India at the central level.”

The recent appointments may influence ongoing tensions in Manipur and establish a new governance dynamic in Mizoram.

title: Five soldiers killed as vehicle falls into gorge in Poonch; Army rules out terror angle - The Hindu
summary:
Five Soldiers Killed as Vehicle Falls into Gorge in Poonch; Army Rules Out Terror Angle

Published on: December 24, 2024 | Source: PTI

Five soldiers were killed and five injured when their vehicle skidded off the road in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch district.

  • The accident occurred in the Pir Panjal Valley, specifically in the Gharoa area.
  • The vehicle was part of a convoy en route from Nilam Headquarters to Balnoi Ghora Post.
  • Initial reports suggest the driver may have lost control at a curve in the road.
  • The vehicle fell into a gorge approximately 300-350 feet deep.
  • Rescue operations are ongoing, and the injured personnel are receiving medical care.
  • The Army has ruled out any terrorist involvement in this incident.
“I pay my heartfelt tribute to the martyrs and hope for the speedy recovery of the injured soldiers. My deepest condolences to the bereaved families.” - Rahul Gandhi

This tragic accident has drawn condolences from various political leaders, including Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah, who expressed sorrow over the loss of life.
newTitle: Five Soldiers Killed in Poonch Vehicle Accident; Army Rules Out Terrorism

title: Union Home Minister Amit Shah reviews implementation of three criminal laws - The Hindu
summary:
Amit Shah Reviews Implementation of New Criminal Laws in Uttarakhand

Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

Union Home Minister Amit Shah held a meeting to assess the implementation of three new criminal laws in Uttarakhand, stressing the importance of technology and timely investigations.

  • Shah reviewed the implementation status with the National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB).
  • He emphasized generating alerts for criminal cases to expedite investigations.
  • Shah demanded full implementation of the laws as soon as possible.
  • He advocated for the use of more forensic vans in every district.
  • Regular monitoring of Zero FIRs and transfer of cases has been stressed.
“There should be regular and continuous monitoring of how many of the total Zero FIRs registered have been brought to justice.”

In conclusion, the implementation of these laws is critical for justice enhancement in Uttarakhand, and the Home Minister is pushing for swift action and technological upgrades.

title: PM Modi stresses fundamental change in the mindset for Viksit Bharat - Business Standard
summary:
PM Modi stresses fundamental change in the mindset for Viksit Bharat

Date: Not specifiedSource: Not specified

Ahead of the presentation of the Budget for FY26, Prime Minister Narendra Modi engaged with economists focusing on maintaining India's growth amidst global uncertainties. He emphasized that achieving Viksit Bharat requires a fundamental change in mindset aimed at making India developed by 2047.

  • Meeting included discussions on global economic challenges and strategies for enhancing employment, especially for youth.
  • Participants highlighted the importance of aligning education with job market demands.
  • There were discussions on improving agricultural productivity, rural employment, and attracting private investment.
  • Conversations also revolved around skilling, vocational education, and integrating into global markets.
  • Prominent economists attended, sharing insights for actionable policies to sustain growth in an uncertain environment.
“Our mandate was to discuss actionable policies to help sustain India’s growth momentum in an increasingly uncertain geopolitical and economic environment.” - Pritam Banerjee

This meeting aimed to develop strategies that align India's growth with evolving economic challenges, ensuring the country's economic stability and growth potential for the future.
newTitle: PM Modi emphasizes a change in mindset for Viksit Bharat by 2047

title: Horrendous but not a crime, says Chhattisgarh HC on man raping 9-yr-old girl’s dead body - Hindustan Times
summary:
Chhattisgarh HC: Raping Dead Body Not Considered Rape Under Indian Penal Code

Date & Source: Dec 24, 2024, Hindustan Times

Introduction: The Chhattisgarh High Court has ruled that raping a dead body does not constitute rape under the Indian Penal Code (IPC), rejecting an appeal by the mother of a 9-year-old Dalit girl who was raped and killed by two men in 2018.

  1. The high court upheld the trial court’s decision to acquit Neelkanth of rape charges since the prime accused Nitin Yadav had already killed the girl.
  2. The court acknowledged the horrendous nature of necrophilia but stated that the law does not currently recognize it as rape.
  3. The girl's mother had appealed against Neelkanth’s acquittal on charges of rape.
The court said, "There can be no disagreement on the issue that dignity and fair treatment is not only available to a living man but also to his dead body... but the law as on date has to be applied to the facts of the case and none of the offences... can be imposed upon the appellant-Neelkanth Nagesh."

Conclusion: The high court dismissed the appeal, stating that the current law does not recognize raping a dead body as a punishable offense.
newTitle: Chhattisgarh HC: Raping Dead Body Not Considered Rape Under Indian Penal Code

title: Arbitration Act: Important Judgments By Supreme Court In 2024 - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Key Supreme Court Rulings on Arbitration Act in 2024

Date: December 31, 2024 | Source: LiveLaw

As 2024 concludes, LiveLaw presents a summary of significant Supreme Court judgments pertaining to the Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996.

  • Arbitral Awards and Modification: The Supreme Court ruled that arbitral awards cannot be modified under Sections 34 and 37 of the Arbitration Act, emphasizing adherence to the intended limitations of the Act.
  • Referral to Larger Bench: A case was referred to a larger bench to determine if courts have the authority to modify awards under the mentioned sections.
  • Amendment Suggestion: The Court suggested Parliament consider amending the Act to establish a limitation period for filing Section 11 applications.
  • Specificity Required for Arbitration Clause: The Court maintained that arbitration clauses must have specific references to be enforceable across contracts.
  • Enforcement of Foreign Awards: Enforcement of foreign awards should only be denied in rare instances, following international standards of bias determination.
  • Limitation and Time Extensions: The Court clarified the extension of time limits for the passing of awards and emphasized limitation periods for appeals based on the Limitation Act.
“Interference with an arbitral award under Section 34 must be confined to permissible grounds under the statute,” affirmed the Supreme Court.

The series of rulings reflect the Court's ongoing efforts to clarify procedural aspects of arbitration and address legislative gaps, contributing to a more defined legal framework within which arbitrations will proceed.
newTitle: Key Supreme Court Rulings on Arbitration Act in 2024

title: UP: Bareilly court summons Asaduddin Owaisi over ‘Jai Palestine’ slogan during Parliament oath - Hindustan Times
summary:
Bareilly Court Summons Asaduddin Owaisi Over 'Jai Palestine' Slogan During Parliament Oath

Publication Date: Dec 24, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

A local court in Bareilly has summoned AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi over his support for Palestine during his oath-taking in Parliament.

  • The court has scheduled a hearing for January 7, 2025.
  • The summons stemmed from a petition filed by lawyer Virendra Gupta, claiming Owaisi's slogan violated constitutional principles.
  • The original petition was rejected, but a revision was approved by the district judge.
  • Owaisi defended his slogan, stating it was not against the Constitution and supported the cause of people in Palestine.
  • He recently won his fifth consecutive election from Hyderabad.
“His slogan was against the Constitution.” - Virendra Gupta

This incident has sparked debate about the appropriateness of political statements made during official ceremonies.
newTitle: Bareilly Court Summons Asaduddin Owaisi Over 'Jai Palestine' Slogan During Parliament Oath

title: Posing As RAW Agent, Agra Gym Trainer Rapes Canadian Woman He Met On Tinder | Shocking Details - News18
‘Constitutional posts not to settle scores’: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar reacts to Opposition’s no-trust motion against him - The Indian Express
summary:
‘Constitutional posts not to settle scores’: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar reacts to Opposition’s no-trust motion against him

Publication Date: December 19, 2023 | Source: Indian Express

In response to the Opposition's notice for his removal, Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar emphasized that individuals in constitutional roles should not engage in settling scores and expressed concerns about actions that threaten national interests.

  • Dhankhar accused the Rajya Sabha Chairman of being “explicitly partisan” and criticized the opposition's motion as flawed.
  • He quoted Chandra Shekhar, stating the notice against him was inadequate and hastily prepared.
  • The Vice President highlighted the importance of expression and dialogue in a democracy.
  • Dhankhar cautioned against orchestrated efforts that may harm national interests.
  • The motion is viewed as a significant yet largely symbolic exercise by the opposition.
“If expression is qualified, compromised, or made subject to coercion, democratic values are flawed.” - Jagdeep Dhankhar

This situation marks the first instance in India's parliamentary history where a no-confidence motion has been filed against a sitting Vice President, symbolizing ongoing tensions in political discourse.
newTitle: Vice President Dhankhar Responds to Opposition's No-Trust Motion
